findings.title: PTAI - Potential Transfer Amount Inconsistency
findings.description: The `transfer()` and `transferFrom()` functions may produce inconsistency between the expected and actual behavior due to ERC20 transfer tax, which is not a standard feature of the ERC20 specification.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Checks
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape. These variables may produce vulnerability issues.

findings.title: OLD - Override Lock Data
findings.description: The Lock data can be overridden after a presale is completed, leading to unintended behavior, potential security vulnerabilities, and unfair treatment of investors who participated in the presale.

findings.title: CR - Code Readability
findings.description: There are array variables that contain multiple different variables of different contexts, making it difficult to understand their purpose and usage within the contract.

findings.title: DSO - Data Structure Optimization
findings.description: The contract utilizes the `Badges` variable as an array, but the business logic of the contract does not require the array to be dynamic. This results in unnecessary memory usage, slower execution times, and more operations being performed than necessary.

findings.title: LDAR - Large Data Array Return
findings.description: The contract contains a function that returns a large array of data, which could make it difficult to use in practice and cause performance issues.

findings.title: RAV - Redundant Array Variable
findings.description: The contract contains an array with two variables that are redundant and not used in any of the contract's logic.

findings.title: DD - Data Duplication
findings.description: The TopCarde contract duplicates WKDNFTToken variables, resulting in unnecessary code complexity, potential inconsistencies in the data, and difficulty in maintaining the codebase.

findings.title: RDM - Revert Descriptive Message
findings.description: The contract does not provide a descriptive message to the `revert` and `require` functions.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure the value cannot be changed after it has been set and decrease gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Non-conformance to Solidity naming conventions can lead to decreased readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L06 - Missing Events Access Control
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task. There are functions that have no event emitted, so it is difficult to track off-chain changes.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.
